clues.text: An authentic signature of his is more likely to include the middle name Amadei instead of Amadeus
This American conducted for the last time on August 19, 1990 at Tanglewood in Massachusetts
This 19th century German opera composer's original last name was Beer, but he lengthened it
Claudio Monteverdi became director of music at St. Mark's Basilica in this city in 1613
This Puccini opera set in China wasn't performed until after his death
In Hyperion, Longfellow wrote, "In this world, a man must either be Anvil or this"
Irving Berlin quipped, "The world would not be in such a snarl if Marx had been Groucho instead of him"
Burt Taylor defined a bore as "a man who, when you ask him how he is", does this
Elbert Hubbard said, "Don't take this too seriously; you will never get out of it alive"
The 4 words that complete the line from Olney Hymns, "God moves in a mysterious way"

In the 1890s, French pharmacist Jules Bengue discovered an ointment for sore ones

In 1977, this new procedure to reopen diseased arteries was developed

rounds.comments: (Mayim: From the book of Exodus in the King James Bible.)

clues.text: "Remember" this "day, to keep it holy"
"Thou shalt not commit" this, so thou shalt better stay true
These 4 words come 2 verses before "Thou shalt not steal"
"Thou shalt not" do this shenanigan with "the name of the Lord thy God"
Putting idols in idle; "Thou shalt not make unto thee any" this kind of "image"

rounds.category: ON A FIRST-NAME BASIS WITH BOOZE

clues.text:
A bourbon:
Mr. Beam

A scotch:
Mr. Walker

A tequila:
Señor Cuervo

A fine cognac:
Monsieur Martin

Essentially a screwdriver with a little Galliano:
Mr. Wallbanger
This type of ball used in pool & in snooker is from a French word for the stick with which it's struck
These perforated plastic balls are made for playing the same-named game in spaces that are too small for baseball
In addition to its volleyballs, this company has been making the official NFL football since 1941
After a century with its original supplier, in 1976 MLB said "Goodbye, Mr." this & made Rawlings its new official ball
The name of this golf ball brand used by champions like Jordan Spieth sounds like a champion
In this classic novel, Cathy's marriage to Edgar doesn't stand a chance against Cathy's love for Heathcliff
In a Daphne du Maurier novel, Maxim de Winter tells his nameless second wife he was not happy with this first one
Nora Ephron's novel about the end of a marriage bemoans "mysteries like... neuritis, neuralgia, acid indigestion &" this title condition
This divorcing doctor is "in trouble" in a novel by Taffy Brodesser-Akner & the FX adaptation
Of this novel about the floundering Wheelers, Richard Yates said his title meant that the this of 1776 hit a dead end in the 1950s
The tibia is also called this bone, a part of the lower leg
Connective tissues include ligaments & these, which usually attach muscles to bones
Newer research suggests that ovarian cancer may actually start in these tubes
Actually produced by the pituitary gland, the hormone TSH is short for this stimulating hormone
The lowest part of the brain stem has this 2-word name

Photographers to the stars:
A PIZZA RAP

Going head over heels:
SOUL MASTER

Don't forget the Hollandaise sauce:
BE DECENT GIGS

A colonizer like Cortés:
CARTOON SQUID

Spittingly, a perfect receptacle:
CRISP DUO
For years, this genial host said, "Good morning, America"
The middle S in his name could have stood for "stone-faced silent star"

Due to its high shoulders, this African antelope's back slopes to the rear
She debuted as the blind girl in "A Patch of Blue"
Germany agreed to send food stockpiled in Berlin for a Cold War crisis to this country
Time reports after women demonstrated in Riyadh, this country formally banned them from driving
A colonel & 8 others were finally charged in the 1989 killing of 6 Jesuits in this country
In 1990, Norplant became the first drug approved in the U.S. since the 1960s for this purpose
2 days before Bush visited this South American country, President Menem put down a military revolt
This line on a garment can be jewel, scoop, cowl or V
1 of 2 types of shears used to keep raw fabric edges from unraveling
Sharps & betweens are 2 types of these used in sewing

Some of these holding devices come with a bag of emery for sharpening, & some look like tomatoes

rounds.text: In 1932, this Mideast country took on the name of its ruling family which still rules today
